<h1 align="center">
  app-wellness
</h1>

A web-based wellness application for managing and monitoring health and fitness activities. Built using PHP & Blade.

> **Status:** 🚧 This app is in progress and still under development. Several new features will be added and existing ones will be improved.

_Have a more specific idea? You may want to check out our vibrant collection of [Laravel starters](https://laravel.com/starter-kits)._

## 🚀 Quick start

1.  **Clone the repository**

    ```sh
    # clone the repository
    git clone https://github.com/ridhorambu93/app-wellness.git
    ```

2.  **Install dependencies**

    ```sh
    composer install
    npm install
    ```

3.  **Configure the environment**

    - Copy `.env.example` to `.env`
    - Edit the `.env` file to set up your database and environment variables

4.  **Generate the application key**

    ```sh
    php artisan key:generate
    ```

5.  **Run database migrations**

    ```sh
    php artisan migrate --seed
    ```

6.  **Start the application**

    ```sh
    php artisan serve
    ```

## 🧐 What's inside?

Main structure of the app-wellness project:

```
.
├── app
├── bootstrap
├── config
├── database
├── public
├── resources
│   └── views
├── routes
├── storage
├── tests
├── .env.example
├── artisan
├── composer.json
├── package.json
└── README.md
```

1.  **`/app`**: Application logic, models, controllers, etc.
2.  **`/resources/views`**: Blade templates for frontend UI.
3.  **`/routes`**: Application route definitions.
4.  **`.env.example`**: Example environment configuration.
5.  **`composer.json` / `package.json`**: Manifest files for PHP and JavaScript dependencies.
6.  **`artisan`**: Laravel CLI tool for running various commands.

## 🎓 Learning Laravel & Blade

- Laravel Documentation: [https://laravel.com/docs](https://laravel.com/docs)
- Blade Tutorial: [https://laravel.com/docs/blade](https://laravel.com/docs/blade)
